definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: North American annual or biennial with long soft hairs on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 北美一年生或兩年生植物，葉子上有柔軟的長毛。

sentences.english: North American annual with red or rose-colored flowers.
sentences.chinese: 北美的一種一年生植物，花紅色或玫瑰紅色。

sentences.english: Annual broadleaf and grass weeds are major problems .
sentences.chinese: 主要問題是一年生闊葉雜草和禾本科雜草。

sentences.english: Marigolds and zinnias are annual plants.
sentences.chinese: 萬壽菊和百日草都是一年生植物。

sentences.english: A perennial plant such as the english daisy cultivated as a biennial .
sentences.chinese: 所有一年生及二年生植物都是結果一次而後死去。

sentences.english: It is an annual with ovate stipules and a glabrous filament tube.
sentences.chinese: 它是一年生草本，具卵形托葉和無毛的花絲筒部。

sentences.english: On one-year-old tawny sticks, with oval-shaped Pikong, especially near the petiole more.
sentences.chinese: 一年生枝淺黃褐色，具橢圓形皮孔，尤以。

sentences.english: There are also annuals, primarily impatiens, that bloom in the shade.
sentences.chinese: 而一年生植物鳳仙花綻放在陰影出。

sentences.english: Annual broadleaf and grass weeds are major problems.
sentences.chinese: 主要問題是一年生闊葉雜草和禾本科雜草。

sentences.english: Herbs annual. Roots conic or spinose.
sentences.chinese: 一年生草本根圓錐形或具刺。

sentences.english: annual grass of Europe and temperate Asia.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲和亞洲溫帶一年生草。

sentences.english: My garden is filled with annual plants.
sentences.chinese: 我的園子里長滿了一年生植物。

sentences.english: Maybe this year I'll sow brilliant annuals everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 也許今年我會到處種上鮮豔的一年生植物。

sentences.english: Therophytes have about 90% in life form of vegetation of soil seed bank.
sentences.chinese: 種子庫中植被生活型一年生佔90%左右。

sentences.english: Leaves basal and cauline; leaf blade palmately divided.
sentences.chinese: 一年生草本葉基生和莖生葉片掌狀全裂。

definition: Graminae or Poaceae, the grass family
Asteraceae or Compositae (composites), a large family of dicotyledonous plants producing scents, includes aster, daisy and sunflower
